/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/TraceLine.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* TraceLine, Copyright (c) 2007 Michael G. Henderson <mghenderson@lanl.gov>
00002  *
00003  *    - This routine is intended to trace a field line and save the points in
00004  *    an array. The idea is that the user can use the adaptive tracing routines
00005  *    to identify critical points on a FL, (and/or if its open, etc.). Here we
00006  *    just assume that the user wants to trace out the line and save the points
00007  *    for later use (for example, to plot the FL or to be used to compute
00008  *    integrals like I, Sb, etc., along the FL).
00009  *
00010  * Some Cautions:
00011  *
00012  *    (1) We need to be careful when using the arrays to interpolate though!
00013  *    The strategy here is to trace with equal intervals in s, and then to tack
00014  *    on the last point of the trace. Thus, the spacing between the last point
00015  *    and the previous to last one will have an odd spacing. You need to keep
00016  *    this in mind when doing interpolation.
00017  *
00018  *
00019  *    (2) Because of the equal spacing, various critical points wont be
00020  *    captured very precisely.  For example, the location and value of Bmin
00021  *    will in general fall between grid points. In order to ensure that this
00022  *    point is representable by a linear interpolation, we need to add it into
00023  *    the interpolation scheme when we interpolate over the interval that
00024  *    contains the point.
00025  *    
00026  *
00027  *
00028  *
00029  * Permission to use, copy, modify, distribute, and sell this software and its
00030  * documentation for any purpose is hereby granted without fee, provided that
00031  * the above copyright notice appear in all copies and that both that copyright
00032  * notice and this permission notice appear in supporting documentation.  No
00033  * representations are made about the suitability of this software for any
00034  * purpose.  It is provided "as is" without express or implied warranty.
00035  *
00036  */
00037 
00038 #include <stdio.h>
00039 #include <stdlib.h>
00040 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00041 
00042 
00043 /*
00044  *  Set the interpolation type to use. (Note, the searches in gsl are not as
00045  *  optimal as they could be. Probably losing some efficiency there. A
00046  *  taylor-made interpolator may do better?)
00047  */
00048 //#define GSL_INTERP  gsl_interp_linear
00049 //#define GSL_INTERP  gsl_interp_akima
00050 #define GSL_INTERP  gsl_interp_cspline
00051 
00052 
00053 
00054 
00055 int Lgm_TraceLine( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, double H0, double sgn, double tol, int AddBminPoint, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00056 
00057     Lgm_Vector  u_scale;
00058     double      Htry, Hdid, Hnext, Hmin, Hmax, s, ss;
00059     double      Sa=0.0, Sc=0.0, d;
00060     double      R0, R, Fa, Fb, Fc, F;
00061     double      Ra, Rb, Rc;
00062     Lgm_Vector  Pa, Pc, P, Bvec, Bcdip;
00063     int         done, reset, n, SavePnt;
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068     Pa.x = Pa.y = Pa.z = 0.0;
00069     Pc.x = Pc.y = Pc.z = 0.0;
00070     P.x  = P.y  = P.z  = 0.0;
00071 
00072 
00073     /*
00074      *  H0 is in km above Earth's surface. Convert to geocentric
00075      *  radius.
00076      */
00077     R0 = H0/Re + 1.0;
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081     Htry = Info->Hmax; // we want to step with constant increments.
00082     Hmin = 0.0001;      // This may be necessary to find the endpoint.
00083     Hmax = Info->Hmax; // Dont use step bigger than this.
00084     u_scale.x =  10.0;  u_scale.y = 1.0; u_scale.z = 10.0;
00085     R = Ra = Rb = Rc = 0.0;
00086     F = Fa = Fb = Fc = 0.0;
00087 
00088     /*
00089      *  Save first point
00090      */
00091     n = 0;
00092     ss = 0.0;
00093     Info->Bfield( u, &Bvec, Info );
00094     Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00095     Info->Px[n]   = u->x;                       // save 3D position vector.
00096     Info->Py[n]   = u->y;                       // 
00097     Info->Pz[n]   = u->z;                       // 
00098     Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00099     Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00100     Lgm_B_cdip( u, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00101     Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00102     ++n;
00103 if (n > LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS){
00104 print("Warning: n > LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS (%d)\n", LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS);
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109 
00110     /*
00111      *   Add code to check to see if the start point is already below the target height.
00112      *   If it is, we can trace up until we are beyond it or some such thing...
00113      */
00114     done  = FALSE;
00115     reset = TRUE;
00116     P = *u;
00117     R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00118     F = R - R0;
00119     if (F < 0.0 ){
00120         // we are already below target height.
00121         // Trace until we are not.
00122         Htry  = 0.1;
00123         while ( !done ) {
00124             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00125             ss += Hdid;  // Note that we should trap conditions where Hdid != Htry since this will be a problem...
00126             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00127             F = R - R0;
00128             if ( F > 0.0 ){
00129                 done = TRUE;
00130             }
00131         }
00132 
00133 
00134 
00135         /*
00136          * Save this (new) point only if its different from the first one)
00137          */
00138         if ( ss > Info->s[n-1] ) {
00139             Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00140             Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00141             Info->Px[n]   = P.x;                        // save 3D position vector.
00142             Info->Py[n]   = P.y;                        //
00143             Info->Pz[n]   = P.z;                        //
00144             Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00145             Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00146             Lgm_B_cdip( &P, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00147             Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00148             ++n;
00149         }
00150 
00151     }
00152 
00153 
00154 
00155 
00156 
00157 
00158     Pa   = P;
00159     Ra   = Lgm_Magnitude( &Pa );
00160     Sa   = 0.0;
00161     
00162 
00163 
00164     /*
00165      *  Keep stepping along the field line until we drop below the target
00166      *  radius, R0.  (Or bail if its open). This completes the endpoints of the
00167      *  bracket pair. We get these points first, because there are field lines
00168      *  that have more than one local minimum in fabs(R-R0). So find Pa and Pc
00169      *  first and then complete the triple later. CHECK on this. I changed this
00170      *  from a minima search to a simple root finder. Is it OK still?
00171      */
00172     P       = Pa;
00173     done    = FALSE;
00174     reset   = TRUE;
00175     SavePnt = TRUE;
00176     while ( !done ) {
00177 
00178         Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00179 
00180 
00181         R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00182         F =  R - R0;
00183 
00184         if (   (P.x > Info->OpenLimit_xMax) || (P.x < Info->OpenLimit_xMin) || (P.y > Info->OpenLimit_yMax) || (P.y < Info->OpenLimit_yMin) 
00185             || (P.z > Info->OpenLimit_zMax) || (P.z < Info->OpenLimit_zMin) ) {
00186             /*
00187              *  Open FL!
00188              */
00189             v->x = v->y = v->z = 0.0;
00190             return(0);
00191         } else if ( (F < 0.0)&&(ss>0.01) ){
00192             done = TRUE;
00193             Pc = P;
00194             Rc = R;
00195             Fc = F;
00196             Sc += Hdid;
00197         } else {
00198             Pa = P;
00199             Fa = F;
00200             Ra = R;
00201             Sa = 0.0;
00202             ss += Hdid;  // Note that we should trap conditions where Hdid != Htry since this will be a problem...
00203             /*
00204              * Compute field strength and save the results in the array.
00205              */
00206             if ( SavePnt && (ss > Info->s[n-1]) ) {
00207                 Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00208                 Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00209                 Info->Px[n]   = P.x;                        // save 3D position vector.
00210                 Info->Py[n]   = P.y;                        //
00211                 Info->Pz[n]   = P.z;                        //
00212                 Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                        // save 3D B-field vector.
00213                 Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00214                 Lgm_B_cdip( &P, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00215                 Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00216                 ++n;
00217             }
00218         }
00219 
00220 
00221 
00222         /*
00223          *  We have been stepping along at a constant Htry. But when we get
00224          *  close to the end we do not want to drop below the surface of the
00225          *  Earth -- some models crash and burn if you do that. To make sure we
00226          *  bracket the minimum, we need to reduce Htry if F is less than our
00227          *  current altitude above the Earth.  Note that F may well be < 0, in
00228          *  which case we already have a bracket and we will bail out of this
00229          *  loop anyway.
00230          *
00231          *  If we have to reduce Htry, then we also want to stop saving the
00232          *  points.  The final point will be the actual end of the FL. (I.e. we
00233          *  dont want all of these smaller steps cluttering up our array at the
00234          *  end.)
00235          */
00236         if ( Htry > (R-1.0) ) {
00237             Htry = 0.5*(R-1.0);
00238             SavePnt = FALSE;
00239          } else {
00240             SavePnt = TRUE;
00241          }
00242 
00243     }
00244 
00245     /*
00246      *  We have a bracket. Now go in for the kill. This just finds where mthe
00247      *  FL intersects the traget altitude. And this point will become the final
00248      *  value in our saved arrays.
00249      *
00250      *  Use golden-section search to converge toward minimum.  (Sa, Sb, Sc) are
00251      *  the distances of the triple points along the FL. For convenience, we
00252      *  maintain Sa = 0.0, so that Sb and Sc are always the distances relative
00253      *  to Pa. (And so Sc is always the width of the bracketed interval. So
00254      *  when Sc gets small enough we bail out and take Pb as the min).
00255      *
00256      */
00257     done  = FALSE;
00258     reset = TRUE;
00259     while (!done) {
00260 
00261         d = Sc - Sa;
00262     
00263         if ( fabs(d) < tol ) {
00264             done = TRUE;
00265         } else {
00266 
00267             P = Pa; Htry = 0.5*d;
00268             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00269             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00270             F =  R - R0;
00271             if ( F >= 0.0 ) {
00272                 Pa = P; Fa = F; Sa += Hdid;
00273                 ss += Hdid;
00274             } else {
00275                 Pc = P; Fc = F; Sc = Sa + Hdid;
00276             }
00277         }    
00278     }
00279 
00280 
00281     /*
00282      *  Compute a final value based on what we have. One possibility is to
00283      *  average Pa and Pc.  This is what we used for a long time, but it may
00284      *  not do well when it comes to interpolating near the endpoints. Another
00285      *  way is the take the point we know is beyond the mirror point altitude.
00286      *  That would (probably?) ensure the real mirror point value is contained
00287      *  in our interp array.
00288      */
00289     //v->x = 0.5*(Pa.x + Pc.x); v->y = 0.5*(Pa.y + Pc.y); v->z = 0.5*(Pa.z + Pc.z);
00290     *v = Pc; ss = Sc;
00291 
00292 
00293     /*
00294      *  Save final point.
00295      */
00296     if ( ss > Info->s[n-1] ) {
00297         Info->Bfield( v, &Bvec, Info );
00298         Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00299         Info->Px[n]   = v->x;                       // save 3D position vector.
00300         Info->Py[n]   = v->y;                       //
00301         Info->Pz[n]   = v->z;                       //
00302         Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00303         Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00304         Lgm_B_cdip( v, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00305         Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00306         ++n;
00307     }
00308     Info->nPnts     = n;                       // set total number of points in the array.
00309     Info->ds        = Info->Hmax;              // spacing in s for the array -- will help to know this
00310                                                // when trying to interpolate.
00311 
00312 
00313 
00314 
00315     /*
00316      *  Add the smin, Bmin point. Only do this if AddBminPoint is TRUE
00317      *  This will only make sense if these values are legitimate for this FL.
00318      *  Perhaps it would be better to force user to do this elesewhere.
00319      * 
00320      */
00321     if ( AddBminPoint ) {
00322 //printf("1) ADDING NEW POINT\n");
00323 // MUST ADD Bcdip for this too!
00324         AddNewPoint( Info->smin, Info->Bmin, &Info->Pmin, Info );
00325     }
00326 //printf("1) F >>>>>>>>> Info->nPnts = %d <<<<<<<<<<\n", Info->nPnts);
00327 
00328 
00329 
00330     return( 1 );
00331 
00332 
00333 }
00334 
00335 
00336 /*
00337  *  This version is almost the same. But here we require that we trace along the FL
00338  *  a minimum distance before trying to do the convergence on radius.
00339  */
00340 int Lgm_TraceLine2( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, double H0, double MinDist, double sgn, double tol, int AddBminPoint, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00341 
00342     Lgm_Vector  u_scale;
00343     double      Htry, Hdid, Hnext, Hmin, Hmax, s, ss;
00344     double      Sa=0.0, Sc=0.0, d;
00345     double      R0, R, Fa, Fb, Fc, F;
00346     double      Ra, Rb, Rc;
00347     Lgm_Vector  Pa, Pc, P, Bvec, Bcdip;
00348     int         done, reset, n, SavePnt;
00349 
00350 
00351 
00352 
00353     Pa.x = Pa.y = Pa.z = 0.0;
00354     Pc.x = Pc.y = Pc.z = 0.0;
00355     P.x  = P.y  = P.z  = 0.0;
00356 
00357 
00358     /*
00359      *  H0 is in km above Earth's surface. Convert to geocentric
00360      *  radius.
00361      */
00362     R0 = H0/Re + 1.0;
00363 
00364 
00365 
00366     Htry = Info->Hmax; // we want to step with constant increments.
00367     Hmin = 0.0001;      // This may be necessary to find the endpoint.
00368 Hmin = 1e-7;
00369     Hmax = Info->Hmax; // Dont use step bigger than this.
00370     u_scale.x =  100.0;  u_scale.y = 100.0; u_scale.z = 100.0;
00371     R = Ra = Rb = Rc = 0.0;
00372     F = Fa = Fb = Fc = 0.0;
00373 
00374 
00375     Pa   = *u;
00376     Ra   = Lgm_Magnitude( &Pa );
00377     Sa   = 0.0;
00378 
00379 
00380 
00381     /*
00382      * Compute field strength at starting point and save the results in the
00383      * array.
00384      */
00385     n = 0;
00386     ss = 0.0;
00387     Info->Bfield( &Pa, &Bvec, Info );
00388     Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00389     Info->Px[n]   = Pa.x;                       // save 3D position vector.
00390     Info->Py[n]   = Pa.y;                       //
00391     Info->Pz[n]   = Pa.z;                       //
00392     Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00393     Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00394     Lgm_B_cdip( &Pa, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00395     Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00396     ++n;
00397 if (n > LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS){
00398 print("Warning: n > LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS (%d)\n", LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS);
00399 }
00400 
00401     
00402 
00403 
00404     /*
00405      *  Keep stepping along the field line until we drop below the target
00406      *  radius, R0.  (Or bail if its open). This completes the endpoints of the
00407      *  bracket pair. We get these points first, because there are field lines
00408      *  that have more than one local minimum in fabs(R-R0). So find Pa and Pc
00409      *  first and then complete the triple later. CHECK on this. I changed this
00410      *  from a minima search to a simple root finder. Is it OK still?
00411      */
00412     P       = Pa;
00413     done    = FALSE;
00414     reset   = TRUE;
00415     SavePnt = TRUE;
00416 //FILE *fpcrap;
00417 //fpcrap = fopen("LINE.txt", "a");
00418     while ( !done ) {
00419 
00420         Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00421 
00422 
00423         R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00424         F =  R - R0;
00425 
00426         if (   (P.x > Info->OpenLimit_xMax) || (P.x < Info->OpenLimit_xMin) || (P.y > Info->OpenLimit_yMax) || (P.y < Info->OpenLimit_yMin) 
00427             || (P.z > Info->OpenLimit_zMax) || (P.z < Info->OpenLimit_zMin) ) {
00428             /*
00429              *  Open FL!
00430              */
00431             v->x = v->y = v->z = 0.0;
00432             return(0);
00433         } else if ( (ss < MinDist) || ( F > 0.0 ) ) { // keep on stepping
00434             Pa = P;
00435             Fa = F;
00436             Ra = R;
00437             Sa = 0.0;
00438             ss += Hdid;  // Note that we should trap conditions where Hdid != Htry since this will be a problem...
00439 
00440             /*
00441              * Compute field strength and save the results in the array.
00442              */
00443             if ( SavePnt && (ss > Info->s[n-1]) ) {
00444                 Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00445                 Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00446                 Info->Px[n]   = P.x;                        // save 3D position vector.
00447                 Info->Py[n]   = P.y;                        //
00448                 Info->Pz[n]   = P.z;                        //
00449                 Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00450                 Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00451                 Lgm_B_cdip( &P, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00452                 Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00453                 ++n;
00454             }
00455         } else {
00456             done = TRUE;
00457             Pc = P;
00458             Rc = R;
00459             Fc = F;
00460             Sc += Hdid;
00461         } 
00462 
00463 
00464 
00465         /*
00466          *  We have been stepping along at a constant Htry. But when we get
00467          *  close to the end we do not want to drop below the surface of the
00468          *  Earth -- some models crash and burn if you do that. To make sure we
00469          *  bracket the minimum, we need to reduce Htry if F is less than our
00470          *  current altitude above the Earth.  Note that F may well be < 0, in
00471          *  which case we already have a bracket and we will bail out of this
00472          *  loop anyway.
00473          *
00474          *  If we have to reduce Htry, then we also want to stop saving the
00475          *  points.  The final point will be the actual end of the FL. (I.e. we
00476          *  dont want all of these smaller steps cluttering up our array at the
00477          *  end.)
00478          */
00479         if ( Htry > (R-1.0) ) {
00480             Htry = 0.5*(R-1.0);
00481             SavePnt = FALSE;
00482         } else {
00483             SavePnt = TRUE;
00484         }
00485 //fprintf(fpcrap, "%g %g\n", P.x, P.z);
00486 //fflush(fpcrap);
00487 //printf("1) B >>>>>>>>> %d %.15lf %.15lf %.15lf  R, R0, F = %.15lf %.15lf %.15lf Hdid = %.15lf Htry = %.15lf s = %.15lf <<<<<<<<<<\n", n, P.x, P.y, P.z, R, R0, F, Htry, Hdid, ss);
00488 
00489     }
00490 //fclose(fpcrap);
00491 
00492     /*
00493      *  We have a bracket. Now go in for the kill. This just finds where mthe
00494      *  FL intersects the traget altitude. And this point will become the final
00495      *  value in our saved arrays.
00496      *
00497      *  Use golden-section search to converge toward minimum.  (Sa, Sb, Sc) are
00498      *  the distances of the triple points along the FL. For convenience, we
00499      *  maintain Sa = 0.0, so that Sb and Sc are always the distances relative
00500      *  to Pa. (And so Sc is always the width of the bracketed interval. So
00501      *  when Sc gets small enough we bail out and take Pb as the min).
00502      *
00503      */
00504     done  = FALSE;
00505     reset = TRUE;
00506     while (!done) {
00507 
00508         d = Sc - Sa;
00509     
00510         if ( fabs(d) < tol ) {
00511             done = TRUE;
00512         } else {
00513 
00514             P = Pa; Htry = 0.5*d;
00515             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00516             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00517             F =  R - R0;
00518             if ( F >= 0.0 ) {
00519                 Pa = P; Fa = F; Sa += Hdid;
00520                 ss += Hdid;
00521             } else {
00522                 Pc = P; Fc = F; Sc = Sa + Hdid;
00523             }
00524 //printf("2) K >>>>>>>>> %d %.15lf %.15lf %.15lf  F = %.15lf Hdid = %.15lf Htry = %.15lf s = %.15lf <<<<<<<<<<\n", n, P.x, P.y, P.z, F, Htry, Hdid, ss);
00525         }    
00526     }
00527 
00528 
00529 
00530     /*
00531      *  Compute a final value based on what we have. One possibility is to
00532      *  average Pa and Pc.  This is what we used for a long time, but it may
00533      *  not do well when it comes to interpolating near the endpoints. Another
00534      *  way is the take the point we know is beyond the mirror point altitude.
00535      *  That would (probably?) ensure the real mirror point value is contained
00536      *  in our interp array.
00537      */
00538     //v->x = 0.5*(Pa.x + Pc.x); v->y = 0.5*(Pa.y + Pc.y); v->z = 0.5*(Pa.z + Pc.z);
00539     *v = Pc; ss = Sc;
00540 
00541 
00542     /*
00543      *  Save final point.
00544      */
00545     if ( ss > Info->s[n-1] ) {
00546         Info->Bfield( v, &Bvec, Info );
00547         Info->s[n]    = ss;                         // save arc length
00548         Info->Px[n]   = v->x;                       // save 3D position vector.
00549         Info->Py[n]   = v->y;                       //
00550         Info->Pz[n]   = v->z;                       //
00551         Info->Bvec[n] = Bvec;                       // save 3D B-field vector.
00552         Info->Bmag[n] = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00553         Lgm_B_cdip( v, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00554         Info->BminusBcdip[n] = Info->Bmag[n] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );     // save field strength (and increment counter)
00555         ++n;
00556     }
00557     Info->nPnts     = n;                       // set total number of points in the array.
00558     Info->ds        = Info->Hmax;              // spacing in s for the array -- will help to know this
00559                                                // when trying to interpolate.
00560 
00561 
00562 
00563 
00564     /*
00565      *  Add the smin, Bmin point. Only do if AddBminPoint is TRUE.
00566      *  This will only make sense if these values are legitimate for this FL.
00567      *  Perhaps it would be better to force user to do this elesewhere.
00568      */
00569     if ( AddBminPoint ) {
00570         AddNewPoint( Info->smin, Info->Bmin, &Info->Pmin, Info );
00571 //printf("2) ADDING NEW POINT\n");
00572     }
00573 
00574 
00575     return( 1 );
00576 
00577 
00578 }
00579 
00580 void ReplaceFirstPoint( double s, double B, Lgm_Vector *P, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00581 
00582     Lgm_Vector  Bcdip;
00583 
00584     Info->s[0]    = s;
00585     Info->Bmag[0] = B;
00586     Info->Px[0]   = P->x;
00587     Info->Py[0]   = P->y;
00588     Info->Pz[0]   = P->z;
00589     Lgm_B_cdip( P, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00590     Info->BminusBcdip[0] = Info->Bmag[0] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );
00591 
00592 }
00593 
00594 
00595 void AddNewPoint( double s, double B, Lgm_Vector *P, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00596 
00597 
00598 
00599     int         i, i1=0, i2=0;
00600     Lgm_Vector  Bcdip;
00601 
00602     /*
00603      * Dont Add if we already have it
00604      */
00605     for (i=0; i<Info->nPnts; ++i){
00606         if (fabs(s-Info->s[i]) < 1e-10) {
00607 //            printf("AddNewPoint: Warning, already have a point very close to this s value. (s,B) = (%g,%g) (Info->s[%d], Info->Bmag[%d]) = (%g, %g). Point not added.\n", 
00608 //                s, B, i, i, Info->s[i], Info->Bmag[i]);
00609             return;
00610         }
00611     }
00612 
00613 
00614     /*
00615      *  This determines the indices that bound the (s, B)  point.
00616      */
00617     if ( s < Info->s[0]) {
00618         i1 = -1;
00619         i2 =  0;
00620     } else if ( s > Info->s[Info->nPnts-1]) {
00621         i1 = Info->nPnts-1;
00622         i2 = Info->nPnts;
00623     } else {
00624 
00625         /*
00626          *  Find where new point should be added
00627          */
00628         for (i=0; i<Info->nPnts; i++){
00629             i1 = i-1;
00630             i2 = i;
00631             if ( Info->s[i] > s ) {
00632                 break;
00633             }
00634         }
00635     
00636         /*
00637          *  Make room for new point
00638          */
00639         for (i=Info->nPnts-1; i>=i2; i--){
00640             Info->s[i+1]    = Info->s[i];
00641             Info->Bmag[i+1] = Info->Bmag[i];
00642             Info->Px[i+1]   = Info->Px[i];
00643             Info->Py[i+1]   = Info->Py[i];
00644             Info->Pz[i+1]   = Info->Pz[i];
00645         }
00646 
00647     }
00648 
00649 
00650     /*
00651      *  Add new point. Note: we are not adding Bvec at this time so dont rely on using Bvec
00652      */
00653     Info->s[i2]    = s;
00654     Info->Bmag[i2] = B;
00655     Info->Px[i2]   = P->x;
00656     Info->Py[i2]   = P->y;
00657     Info->Pz[i2]   = P->z;
00658     Lgm_B_cdip( P, &Bcdip, Info ); 
00659     Info->BminusBcdip[i2] = Info->Bmag[i2] - Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcdip );
00660     ++Info->nPnts;
00661 
00662 
00663 }
00664 
00665 
00666 
00667 void InitSpline( Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00668 
00669 
00670 
00671     int i;
00672 
00673 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00674 
00675     for (i=0; i<Info->nPnts-1; ++i){
00676         if (Info->s[i] >= Info->s[i+1]) {
00677             printf("InitSpline: Error? Info->s[%d] = %g    Info->s[%d] = %g\n", i, Info->s[i], i+1, Info->s[i+1]);
00678         }
00679     }
00680     
00681     
00682 
00683     /*
00684      *  Now that we have the array of points, lets initialize the gsl spline stuff
00685      *
00686      *  To evaluate the spline, use the following:
00687      *
00688      *      y = gsl_spline_eval( Info->spline, x, Info->acc );
00689      *
00690      *
00691      */
00692     Info->acc    = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
00693     Info->accPx  = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
00694     Info->accPy  = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
00695     Info->accPz  = gsl_interp_accel_alloc( );
00696     if ( Info->nPnts > 2 ){
00697         Info->spline   = gsl_spline_alloc( GSL_INTERP, Info->nPnts );
00698         Info->splinePx = gsl_spline_alloc( GSL_INTERP, Info->nPnts );
00699         Info->splinePy = gsl_spline_alloc( GSL_INTERP, Info->nPnts );
00700         Info->splinePz = gsl_spline_alloc( GSL_INTERP, Info->nPnts );
00701     } else {
00702         Info->spline   = gsl_spline_alloc( gsl_interp_linear, Info->nPnts );
00703         Info->splinePx = gsl_spline_alloc( gsl_interp_linear, Info->nPnts );
00704         Info->splinePy = gsl_spline_alloc( gsl_interp_linear, Info->nPnts );
00705         Info->splinePz = gsl_spline_alloc( gsl_interp_linear, Info->nPnts );
00706     }
00707     //gsl_spline_init( Info->spline, Info->s, Info->Bmag, Info->nPnts );
00708     gsl_spline_init( Info->spline,   Info->s, Info->BminusBcdip, Info->nPnts );
00709     gsl_spline_init( Info->splinePx, Info->s, Info->Px, Info->nPnts );
00710     gsl_spline_init( Info->splinePy, Info->s, Info->Py, Info->nPnts );
00711     gsl_spline_init( Info->splinePz, Info->s, Info->Pz, Info->nPnts );
00712 
00713 
00714 }
00715 
00716 void FreeSpline( Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00717 //    gsl_set_error_handler_off(); // Turn off gsl default error handler
00718     if ( Info->spline != NULL ) gsl_spline_free( Info->spline );
00719     if ( Info->splinePx != NULL ) gsl_spline_free( Info->splinePx );
00720     if ( Info->splinePy != NULL ) gsl_spline_free( Info->splinePy );
00721     if ( Info->splinePz != NULL ) gsl_spline_free( Info->splinePz );
00722     if ( Info->acc != NULL ) gsl_interp_accel_free( Info->acc );
00723     if ( Info->accPx != NULL ) gsl_interp_accel_free( Info->accPx );
00724     if ( Info->accPy != NULL ) gsl_interp_accel_free( Info->accPy );
00725     if ( Info->accPz != NULL ) gsl_interp_accel_free( Info->accPz );
00726 }
00727 
00728 
00729 
00730 
00731 /*
00732  * Routine to interpolate B along a FL that was traced by the routine above.
00733  * I.e. compute B(s) using the pre-traced arrays.
00734  */
00735 
00736 double  BofS( double s, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00737 
00738     double      m, ds, B, BminusBcdip, Bcdip;
00739     int         i1, i2;
00740     Lgm_Vector  P, Bvec;
00741 
00742     /*
00743      * Use GSL to compute BminusBcdip(s)
00744      */
00745     BminusBcdip = gsl_spline_eval( Info->spline, s, Info->acc );
00746     
00747     /*
00748      * Interpolate to get P(s) and Bcdip(P(s))
00749      */
00750     P.x = gsl_spline_eval( Info->splinePx, s, Info->accPx );
00751     P.y = gsl_spline_eval( Info->splinePy, s, Info->accPy );
00752     P.z = gsl_spline_eval( Info->splinePz, s, Info->accPz );
00753     Lgm_B_cdip( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00754     Bcdip = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00755     B = BminusBcdip + Bcdip;
00756     
00757     return( B );
00758 
00759 
00760     // NOT REACHABLE. DECIDE WHAT WE WHAT TO DO HERE...
00761 
00762 
00763     /*
00764      * user needs to make sure s is <= the end point value
00765      */
00766     if ( s > Info->s[Info->nPnts-1]+1e-7 ) {
00767         return(-999.9);
00768     }
00769 
00770 
00771     /*
00772      * Try to guess which indices we need to interpolate between
00773      */
00774     i1 = (int)(s/Info->ds);
00775     i2 = i1+1;
00776     if ((i1 > Info->nPnts-1)||(i1 > Info->nPnts-1)){
00777         return(-9999.9);
00778     }
00779 
00780     if (i2 > Info->nPnts-1){
00781         i2 = Info->nPnts-1;
00782         i1 = i2-1;
00783     }
00784 
00785 
00786     /*
00787      * If smin (location of Bmin) is in the interval [s(i1):s(i2)]
00788      * then we need to do more work...
00789      */
00790     if ( (i1==Info->imin1) && (i2==Info->imin2)){
00791         if ( s > Info->smin ){
00792             ds = Info->s[i2] - Info->smin;
00793             if ( ds > 1e-7) {
00794                 m  = (Info->Bmag[i2] - Info->Bmin)/ds;
00795                 B  = m*(s-Info->smin) + Info->Bmin;
00796             } else {
00797                 // handles possibles cases where smin is extremely close to one
00798                 // of the grid points.
00799                 B = Info->Bmag[i2];
00800             }
00801         } else {
00802             ds = Info->smin - Info->s[i1];
00803             if ( ds > 1e-7) {
00804                 m  = (Info->Bmin - Info->Bmag[i1])/ds;
00805                 B  = m*(s-Info->s[i1]) + Info->Bmag[i1];
00806             } else {
00807                 B = Info->Bmag[i1];
00808             }
00809         }
00810     } else {
00811         ds = Info->s[i2] - Info->s[i1];             // run (takes care of last interval where ds != Info->ds)
00812         if (fabs(ds) > 1e-7){
00813             m  = (Info->Bmag[i2] - Info->Bmag[i1])/ds;  // slope
00814             B  = m*(s-Info->s[i1]) + Info->Bmag[i1];    // linearly interped value
00815         } else {    
00816             B  = Info->Bmag[i1];   
00817         }
00818     }
00819 
00820 
00821     
00822     
00823 
00824     return( B );
00825 
00826 
00827 }
00828 
00829 
00830 
00831 
00832 /*
00833  *   Compute the +/-s vals of the mirror points. Start at s(Bmin) point.
00834  */
00835 int  SofBm( double Bm, double *ss, double *sn, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00836 
00837     int     done;
00838     double  s, s1, s2;
00839     double  B, B1, B2, d;
00840 
00841 
00842 
00843     // test to see that we have enough points
00844     if (Info->nPnts < 3 ) {
00845         return(FALSE);
00846     }
00847 
00848     // test to see that array brackets Bm
00849     if ( (Bm > Info->Bmag[0]) || (Bm > Info->Bmag[Info->nPnts-1]) ){
00850         return(FALSE);
00851     }
00852 
00853 
00854     s = Info->smin;
00855     B = BofS( s, Info );
00856 
00857     s1 = s2 = s;
00858     B1 = B2 = B;
00859 
00860     
00861     /*
00862      * Scan up FL to bracket the northern mirror point
00863      */
00864     done = FALSE;
00865     while( !done && (s <= Info->s[Info->nPnts-1]) ) {
00866         s += .05;
00867         if (s > Info->s[Info->nPnts-1]) s = Info->s[Info->nPnts-1];
00868 
00869         B = BofS( s, Info );
00870         if ( B > Bm ) {
00871             /*
00872              * we passed the value of Bm (i.e. Bm-Btmp is negative) , use this
00873              * s as an upper bracket.
00874              */
00875             s2 = s;
00876             B2 = B;
00877             done = TRUE;
00878         } else {
00879             /*
00880              * havent passed the value of Bm yet, update s1 to be lower edge
00881              * of bracket
00882              */
00883             s1 = s;
00884             B1 = B;
00885         }
00886     }
00887 
00888 
00889     /*
00890      * Find zero using bi-section
00891      */
00892     done = FALSE;
00893     while ( !done ){
00894         s = 0.5*(s2+s1); // bisect
00895         B = BofS( s, Info );
00896         d = Bm-B;
00897         if ( fabs(d) < 1e-7)  {
00898             done = TRUE;        // converged
00899         } else if ( d > 0.0 ) {
00900             s1 = s;
00901             B1 = B;
00902         } else {
00903             s2 = s;
00904             B2 = B;
00905         }
00906     }
00907 
00908     *sn = s;
00909 
00910 
00911 
00912 
00913 
00914     s = Info->smin;
00915     B = BofS( s, Info );
00916 
00917     s1 = s2 = s;
00918     
00919     /*
00920      * Scan down FL to bracket the southern mirror point
00921      */
00922     done = FALSE;
00923     while( !done && (s <= Info->s[Info->nPnts-1]) ) {
00924         s -= .05;
00925         if (s < 0.0) s = 0.0;
00926         if ( (B = BofS( s, Info )) > Bm ) {
00927             /*
00928              * we passed the value of Bm (i.e. Bm-Btmp is negative) , use this
00929              * s as an upper bracket.
00930              */
00931             s2 = s;
00932             B2 = B;
00933             done = TRUE;
00934         } else {
00935             /*
00936              * havent passed the value of Bm yet, update s1 to be lower edge
00937              * of bracket
00938              */
00939             s1 = s;
00940             B1 = B;
00941         }
00942     }
00943 
00944     /*
00945      * Find zero using bi-section
00946      */
00947     done = FALSE;
00948     while ( !done ){
00949         s = 0.5*(s2+s1); // bisect
00950         B = BofS( s, Info );
00951         d = Bm-B;
00952         if ( fabs(d) < 1e-7)  {
00953             done = TRUE;        // converged
00954         } else if ( d > 0.0 ) {
00955             s1 = s;
00956             B1 = B;
00957         } else {
00958             s2 = s;
00959             B2 = B;
00960         }
00961     }
00962 
00963     *ss = s;
00964 
00965 
00966     return( TRUE );
00967 
00968 }
